column4: Hey all, is there something similar to the shutdown command on the system menu in bash which can be run as a non-root user?
I understand visudo allows commands that are standardly root to be run all the time by regular users, so what's the command that is run by the shutdown launcher that bypasses this?
when you allow SHUTDOWN_CMDS in visudo, you can shut down using sudo shutdown -h now and it wont ask for your password. But read what actionparsnip says about security issues
